summary: This is an email chain from June 2020 regarding FBI travel approval to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation believed to be in Massachusetts. The email shows coordination between FBI personnel to apprehend an individual and transport them to New York.

persons.name: SSA
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent - Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit
persons.context: The sender of the first email, requesting to be notified as soon as an arrest is made in order to submit a Significant Case Notification (SCN).

events.title: Travel Approval Request for Arrest Operation
events.description: An FBI agent requests approval to travel to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, with plans to drive up and possibly escort the target back to New York.

keyFacts: In June 2020, the FBI was actively planning to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation.
The target was believed to be located in Massachusetts.
The plan involved FBI agents driving to Massachusetts, making the arrest, and possibly escorting the target back to New York.
The email indicates a request for a Significant Case Notification (SCN) to be submitted immediately upon the arrest.
The document shows ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case years after Epstein's death.
